Description: Arrow-head of dark flint, with concave or ‘hollow’ base and incurving barbs with squared tips, bifacially worked.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (p. 7; pl. xxix.6; xxvi.1)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
